# Beyond ggplot2 Fundamentals

# 1 Getting Started

## 1.1 Install and Load Required Libraries


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, 
               ggthemes, hrbrthemes,
               tidyverse) 
```
:::


## 1.2 Importing Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::


# 2 Beyond ggplot2 Annotation: ggrepel


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  geom_label(aes(label = ID), 
             hjust = .5, 
             vjust = -.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 2.1 Working with ggrepel


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  geom_label_repel(aes(label = ID), 
                   fontface = "bold") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: ggrepel: 317 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider
increasing max.overlaps
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# 3 Beyond ggplot2 Themes


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) + geom_histogram(bins=20, boundary = 100, color="grey25", fill="grey90") + theme_gray() + ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 3.1 Working with ggtheme package


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_economist()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 3.2 Working with hrbthems Package


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in grid.Call(C_stringMetric, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label)): font family
not found in Windows font database

not found in Windows font database

not found in Windows font database
```


:::

```

family not found in Windows font database

family not found in Windows font database
Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
family not found in Windows font database
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
font family not found in Windows font database

font family not found in Windows font database
Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
font family not found in Windows font database
Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :

```


:::

![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}

The second goal centers around productivity for a production workflow.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum(axis_title_size = 18,
              base_size = 15,
              grid = "Y")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in grid.Call(C_stringMetric, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label)): font family
not found in Windows font database
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
family not found in Windows font database
Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
family not found in Windows font database
Warning in grid.Call(C_textBounds, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, : font
family not found in Windows font database
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
font family not found in Windows font database
Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
font family not found in Windows font database
Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
font family not found in Windows font database
Warning in grid.Call.graphics(C_text, as.graphicsAnnot(x$label), x$x, x$y, :
font family not found in Windows font database
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::

# 4 Beyond Single Graph


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p1 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") + 
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

p1
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p2 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of English scores")

p2
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p3 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x= MATHS, 
                 y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")

p3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 4.1 Creating Composite Graphics: patchwork methods

1.  two-column layout using the plus sign
2.  paranthesis () to create subplot group
3.  two-row layout using division sign

## 4.2 Combining two ggplot2 graphs


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p1 + p2
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 4.3 Combining three ggplot2 graphs


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
(p1 / p2) | p3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 4.4 Creating a composite figure with tag


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
((p1 / p2) | p3) + 
  plot_annotation(tag_levels = 'I')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 4.5 Creating a figure with insert


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p3 + inset_element(p2, 
                   left = 0.02, 
                   bottom = 0.7, 
                   right = 0.5, 
                   top = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 4.6 Creating a composite figure by using patchwork and ggtheme 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
patchwork <- (p1 / p2) | p3
patchwork & theme_economist()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
